moves.1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 c6 3. c3 Nd7 4. Bf4 b6: Weak, maybe. The fianchetto is a slow plan for the black's lsb, but it is coherent.
moves.5. e3 Ngf6 6. h3 Nh5 7. Bh2 e6: The discovered threat against the black knight is ok, but not enough for me...
moves.8. Bd3 Be7 9. Nbd2 O-O 10. Qc2: well, if he leaves me, I develop attacking.
moves.11. Bxh7+ Kh8: provided g6 traps my bishop, and Bxg6, fxB, Qxg6, Nmoves and it's ok for me, but not decisive, I tried a crazy sac (it was an over the board blitz)
moves.12. Bg6 fxg6 13. Qxg6: As wrong sac, since the knight retires and nothing happens.
moves.13... Nhf6 14. Ne5 Nxe5 15. dxe5 Nh7: Now, Qxd6 is tricky, but I have my 3 pawns for the piece. But no attack anymore.
moves.16. f4: Consolidating for o-o-o and bring more firepower to the lines.
moves.16... Kg8 17. O-O-O: Now I can play Ne4. But I was lost, anyway. c5...
moves.17... Qe8: Well, this threats with a queen exchange that leaves me with a long, long game...
moves.18. Qxe6+: So why don't try the crazy way?
moves.18... Rf7: If Qf7, Qd8, but it was not that strong.
moves.19. g4: Another "crazy" attack move, just looking for something (f6 fork, for instance)
moves.20. Qg6: Rf8 and it forces queen's exchange, and my attack vanishes.
moves.21... Qd8 22. Nf3: Aiming at nothing, overlooking the danger.
moves.25. g5: Maybe better was h4, and if Bxh4, g5 or Bg1.
moves.26. h4: Just a stupid move: Bg4, and I cannot avoid exchanges and losing.
moves.26... Bb7: A little help by my opponent.
moves.27... Ne6: By moving the queen, I would have be driven into defensive mood... and losing.
moves.28... gxh5 29. Bg3 Qe8 30. exd5: Well, now Rd8, since I cannot advance the pawn without losing a Night...
moves.30... Ng7: Attack produces fear. A very unpolite way to win at chess (don't try it with computers).
moves.31. Nh4: I have to stop Nf5, and try to clear the white diagonal as soon as possible.
moves.31... Qd7 32. Rhf1: Probably better Rg1, or e6 at once.
moves.32... Nf5 33. e6: Black could have played returning the queen, with Nxbg3, exQ, NxR...
moves.33... Qd6 34. g6+: May as well try the trick.
moves.34... Kg8 35. Nxf5: Piece returned, and material balance almost restored. But what a pawn's line!
moves.35... Qc7: Forgive them, Father, since they don't know what they are doing...
moves.36. d6: and resigned. Incredibly enough, I won this one...
